javadoc:
Manages the "Docking" arrangement of a set of components and actions. The components can be "docked" 
 together or exist in their own window.  Actions can be associated with components so they
 "move" with the component as it moved from one location to another.
 
 Components are added via ComponentProviders.  A ComponentProvider is an interface for getting
 a component and its related information.  The docking window manager will get the component
 from the provider as needed.  It is up to the provider if it wants to reuse the component or
 recreate a new one when the component is requested.  When the user "hides" (by using 
 the x button on the component area) a component, the docking window manager removes all
 knowledge of the component and will request it again from the provider if the component
 becomes "unhidden".  The provider is also notified whenever a component is hidden.   Some
 providers will use the notification to remove the provider from the docking window manager so
 that the can not "unhide" the component using the built-in window menu.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new DockingWindowManager

params.name: toolName
params.comment: the name of the tool.

params.name: images
params.comment: the images to use for windows in this window manager

params.name: docListener
params.comment: the listener to be notified when the user closes the manager.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new DockingWindowManager

params.name: toolName
params.comment: the name of the tool

params.name: images
params.comment: the list of icons to set on the window

params.name: docListener
params.comment: the listener to be notified when the user closes the manager

params.name: modal
params.comment: if true then the root window will be a modal dialog instead of a frame

params.name: isDocking
params.comment:
true for normal operation, false to suppress docking support(removes
 component headers and window menu)

params.name: hasStatusBar
params.comment: if true a status bar will be created for the main window

params.name: factory
params.comment: the drop target factory

methods.name: enableDiagnosticActions
methods.comment:
A static initializer allowing additional diagnostic actions
 to be enabled added to all frame and dialog windows.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the help service for the all docking window managers.
@param helpSvc the help service to use.
methods.name: setHelpService
methods.comment: Sets the help service for the all docking window managers.

params.name: helpSvc
params.comment: the help service to use.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the global help service.
@return the global help service.
methods.name: getHelpService
methods.comment: Returns the global help service.

return.comment: the global help service.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the ComponentWindowingPlaceholder that currently has focus.
@return the ComponentWindowingPlaceholder that currently has focus.
methods.name: getFocusedProviderPlaceholder
methods.comment: Returns the ComponentWindowingPlaceholder that currently has focus.

return.comment: the ComponentWindowingPlaceholder that currently has focus.

methods.name: getInstance
methods.comment:
A convenience method for getting the window for component and then calling
 #getInstanceForWindow(Window).

params.name: component
params.comment:
The component for which to get the associated DockingWindowManager
        instance.

return.comment: The DockingWindowManager instance associated with component

methods.javadoc:
Returns the last active docking window manager which is visible.
@return the last active docking window manager which is visible.
methods.name: getActiveInstance
methods.comment: Returns the last active docking window manager which is visible.

return.comment: the last active docking window manager which is visible.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a new list of all DockingWindowManager instances know to exist.
@return a new list of all DockingWindowManager instances know to exist.
methods.name: getAllDockingWindowManagers
methods.comment: Returns a new list of all DockingWindowManager instances know to exist.

return.comment: a new list of all DockingWindowManager instances know to exist.

methods.name: setHelpLocation
methods.comment:
Register a specific Help content URL for a component.
 The DocWinListener will be notified with the helpURL if the specified
 component 'c' has focus and the help key is pressed.

params.name: c
params.comment: component on which to set help.

params.name: helpLocation
params.comment: help content location

methods.name: setToolName
methods.comment:
Set the tool name which is displayed as the title
 for all windows.

params.name: toolName
params.comment: tool name / title

methods.javadoc:
Set the Icon for all windows.
@param icon image icon
methods.name: setIcon
methods.comment: Set the Icon for all windows.

params.name: icon
params.comment: image icon

methods.name: containsProvider
methods.comment: Returns true if this manager contains the given provider.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider for which to check

return.comment: true if this manager contains the given provider.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the root window frame.
@return the root window frame.
methods.name: getRootFrame
methods.comment: Returns the root window frame.

return.comment: the root window frame.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the provider that should get the default focus when no component has focus.
@param provider the provider that should get the default focus when no component has focus.
methods.name: setDefaultComponent
methods.comment: Sets the provider that should get the default focus when no component has focus.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider that should get the default focus when no component has focus.

methods.name: getProviderWindow
methods.comment: Get the window which contains the specified Provider's component.

params.name: provider
params.comment: component provider

return.comment: window or null if component is not visible or not found.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the active window (or the root window if nobody has yet been made active).
@return the active window.
methods.name: getActiveWindow
methods.comment: Returns the active window (or the root window if nobody has yet been made active).

return.comment: the active window.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current active component.
@return the current active component.
methods.name: getActiveComponent
methods.comment: Returns the current active component.

return.comment: the current active component.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the component which has focus
@return the placeholder
methods.name: getFocusedComponent
methods.comment: Returns the component which has focus

return.comment: the placeholder

methods.name: setVisible
methods.comment: Sets the visible state of the set of docking windows.

params.name: state
params.comment:
if true the main window and all sub-windows are set to be visible.  If
 state is false, then all windows are set to be invisible.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the set of windows associated with this window manager are visible.
@return true if the set of windows associated with this window manager are visible.
methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Returns true if the set of windows associated with this window manager are visible.

return.comment: true if the set of windows associated with this window manager are visible.

methods.name: isVisible
methods.comment: Returns true if the specified provider's component is visible

params.name: provider
params.comment: component provider

return.comment: true if the specified provider's component is visible

methods.name: addComponent
methods.comment:
Adds a new component (via the provider) to be managed by this docking window manager.
 The component is initially hidden.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the component provider

methods.name: addComponent
methods.comment:
Adds a new component (vial the provider) to be managed by this docking window manager.
 The component will be initially shown or hidden based on the the "show" parameter.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the component provider.

params.name: show
params.comment: indicates whether or not the component should be initially shown.

methods.name: getComponentProvider
methods.comment:
Returns the ComponentProvider with the given name.  If more than one provider exists with the name,
 one will be returned, but it could be any one of them.

params.name: name
params.comment: the name of the provider to return.

return.comment: a provider with the given name, or null if no providers with that name exist.

methods.name: getComponentProvider
methods.comment: The first provider instance with a class equal to that of the given class

params.name: clazz
params.comment: the class of the desired provider

return.comment: the first provider instance with a class equal to that of the given class.

methods.name: getComponentProviders
methods.comment:
Gets all components providers with a matching class.  Some component providers will have
 multiple instances in the tool

params.name: clazz
params.comment: The class of the provider

return.comment: all found provider instances

methods.name: showComponentHeader
methods.comment:
Set whether a component's header should be shown; the header is the
 component that is dragged in order to move the component within the
 tool, or out of the tool into a separate window.

params.name: provider
params.comment: provider of the visible component in the tool

params.name: b
params.comment: true means to show the header

methods.name: getSubTitle
methods.comment: Returns the current subtitle for the component for the given provider.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the component provider of the component for which to get its subtitle.

return.comment: the current subtitle for the component for the given provider.

methods.name: removeComponent
methods.comment:
Removes the ComponentProvider (component) from the docking windows manager.  The location
 of the window will be remember and reused if the provider is added back in later.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider to be removed.

methods.name: getComponentActions
methods.comment: Get an iterator over the actions for the given provider.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the component provider for which to iterate over all its owned actions.

return.comment: null if the provider does not exist in this window manager

methods.javadoc:
Removes all components and actions associated with the given owner.
@param owner the name of the owner whose associated component and actions should be removed.
methods.name: removeAll
methods.comment: Removes all components and actions associated with the given owner.

params.name: owner
params.comment: the name of the owner whose associated component and actions should be removed.

methods.name: addLocalAction
methods.comment:
Adds an action that will be associated with the given provider.  These actions will
 appear in the local header for the component as a toolbar button or a drop-down menu
 item if it has an icon and menu path respectively.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider whose header on which the action is to be placed.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to add to the providers header bar.

methods.name: removeProviderAction
methods.comment: Removes the action from the given provider's header bar.

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider whose header bar from which the action should be removed.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to be removed from the provider's header bar.

methods.javadoc:
Adds an action to the global menu or toolbar which appear in the main frame. If
 the action has a menu path, it will be in the menu.  If it has an icon, it will
 appear in the toolbar.
@param action the action to be added.
methods.name: addToolAction
methods.comment:
Adds an action to the global menu or toolbar which appear in the main frame. If
 the action has a menu path, it will be in the menu.  If it has an icon, it will
 appear in the toolbar.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to be added.

methods.javadoc:
Removes the given action from the global menu and toolbar.
@param action the action to be removed.
methods.name: removeToolAction
methods.comment: Removes the given action from the global menu and toolbar.

params.name: action
params.comment: the action to be removed.

methods.name: showComponent
methods.comment:
Hides or shows the component associated with the given provider.
 
 Note:  This method will not show the given provider if it has not previously been
 added via addComponent(...).

params.name: provider
params.comment: the provider of the component to be hidden or shown.

params.name: visibleState
params.comment: true to show the component, false to hide it.

methods.javadoc:
Releases all resources used by this docking window manager.  Once the dispose method
 is called, no other calls to this object should be made.
methods.name: dispose
methods.comment:
Releases all resources used by this docking window manager.  Once the dispose method
 is called, no other calls to this object should be made.

methods.javadoc:
Generates a JDOM element object for saving the window managers state to XML.
@param rootXMLElement The root element to which to save XML data.
methods.name: saveToXML
methods.comment: Generates a JDOM element object for saving the window managers state to XML.

params.name: rootXMLElement
params.comment: The root element to which to save XML data.

methods.javadoc:
Save this docking window manager's window layout and positioning information as XML.
@return An XML element with the above information.
methods.name: saveWindowingDataToXml
methods.comment: Save this docking window manager's window layout and positioning information as XML.

return.comment: An XML element with the above information.

methods.javadoc:
Restores the docking window managers state from the XML information.
@param rootXMLElement JDOM element from which to extract the state information.
methods.name: restoreFromXML
methods.comment: Restores the docking window managers state from the XML information.

params.name: rootXMLElement
params.comment: JDOM element from which to extract the state information.

methods.javadoc:
Restore to the docking window manager the layout and positioning information from XML.
@param windowData The XML element containing the above information.
methods.name: restoreWindowDataFromXml
methods.comment: Restore to the docking window manager the layout and positioning information from XML.

params.name: windowData
params.comment: The XML element containing the above information.

methods.name: showEditWindow
methods.comment: Display an text edit box on top of the specified component.

params.name: defaultText
params.comment: initial text to be displayed in edit box

params.name: c
params.comment: component over which the edit box will be placed

params.name: r
params.comment:
specifies the bounds of the edit box relative to the 
 component.  The height is ignored.  The default text field height 
 is used as the preferred height.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
when the edit is complete, this listener is notified 
 with the new text.  The edit box is dismissed prior to notifying
 the listener.

methods.name: putPreferenceState
methods.comment:
Adds a PreferenceState object to this window manager instance that is bound to the given
 key.  When the state of the tool using this window manager is saved, then the mapped
 preferences will also be saved.

params.name: key
params.comment: The key with which to store the preferences.

params.name: state
params.comment: The state object to store.

methods.name: getPreferenceState
methods.comment:
Gets a preferences state object stored with the given key.  The state objects are loaded
 from persistent storage when the tool using this window manager has its state loaded.

params.name: key
params.comment: The key with which to store the preferences.

return.comment: the PrefrenceState object stored by the given key, or null if one does not exist

methods.javadoc:
Removes the Preferences state for the given key.
@param key the key to the preference state to be removed
methods.name: removePreferenceState
methods.comment: Removes the Preferences state for the given key.

params.name: key
params.comment: the key to the preference state to be removed

methods.javadoc:
Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent
@param dialogComponent the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog
methods.name: showDialogOnActiveWindow
methods.comment: Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog

methods.javadoc:
Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent
@param dialogComponent the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog
methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment: Shows the dialog using the tool's currently active window as a parent

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the given component's parent frame, centering the dialog 
 on the given component

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

params.name: centeredOnComponent
params.comment: the component on which to center the dialog.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the window containing the given componentProvider as its 
 parent window

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

params.name: centeredOnProvider
params.comment:
the component provider that is used to find a parent 
        window for this dialog.   The dialog is centered on this component 
        provider's component.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the given parent component to find a parent window and to 
 position the dialog. If a Window can be found containing the given component, it 
 will be used as the parent window for the dialog.  If the component is null or not 
 contained in a window, the current active window manager will be used to parent 
 the dialog.  If there are no active tools, then a frame will be created to parent
 the dialog.

params.name: parent
params.comment:
the component whose window over which the given dialog will be shown; null
        signals to use the active window

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog.

methods.name: showDialog
methods.comment:
Shows the dialog using the given parent window using the optional component for 
 positioning

params.name: parent
params.comment: the component whose window over which the given dialog will be shown

params.name: dialogComponent
params.comment: the DialogComponentProvider object to be shown in a dialog

params.name: centeredOnComponent
params.comment: the component over which the dialog will be centered if not null

methods.name: setHomeButton
methods.comment:
Sets the icon for this window's 'home button'. This button, when pressed,
 will show the tool's main application window.

params.name: icon
params.comment: the button's icon

params.name: callback
params.comment: the callback to execute when the button is pressed by the user

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if a status bar is present.
@return true if a status bar is present.
methods.name: hasStatusBar
methods.comment: Returns true if a status bar is present.

return.comment: true if a status bar is present.

methods.name: addStatusItem
methods.comment:
Add a new status item component to the status area.  The preferred height and border
 for the component will be altered.  The components preferred width will be 
 preserved.

params.name: c
params.comment: the status item component to add

params.name: addBorder
params.comment: True signals to add a border to the status area

params.name: rightSide
params.comment:
component will be added to the right-side of the status
 area if true, else it will be added immediately after the status text area
 if false.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the specified status item.
@param c status component previously added.
methods.name: removeStatusItem
methods.comment: Remove the specified status item.

params.name: c
params.comment: status component previously added.

methods.javadoc:
Set the status text in the active component window.
@param text status text
methods.name: setStatusText
methods.comment: Set the status text in the active component window.

params.name: text
params.comment: status text

methods.name: setMenuGroup
methods.comment:
Set the menu group associated with a cascaded submenu.  This allows
 a cascading menu item to be grouped with a specific set of actions.
 The default group for a cascaded submenu is the name of the submenu.

params.name: menuPath
params.comment:
menu name path where the last element corresponds 
 to the specified group name.

params.name: group
params.comment: group name

methods.name: setMenuGroup
methods.comment:
Set the menu group associated with a cascaded submenu.  This allows
 a cascading menu item to be grouped with a specific set of actions.
 
 The default group for a cascaded submenu is the name of the submenu.

params.name: menuPath
params.comment: menu name path where the last element corresponds to the specified group name.

params.name: group
params.comment: group name

params.name: menuSubGroup
params.comment:
the name used to sort the cascaded menu within other menu items at 
                     its level

methods.javadoc:
Sets the mode such that all satellite docking windows always appear on top of the root window
@param windowsOnTop true to set mode to on top, false to disable on top mode.
methods.name: setWindowsOnTop
methods.comment: Sets the mode such that all satellite docking windows always appear on top of the root window

params.name: windowsOnTop
params.comment: true to set mode to on top, false to disable on top mode.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the window mode is "satellite windows always on top of root window".
@return true if the window mode is "satellite windows always on top of root window".
methods.name: isWindowsOnTop
methods.comment: Returns true if the window mode is "satellite windows always on top of root window".

return.comment: true if the window mode is "satellite windows always on top of root window".

methods.name: getWindows
methods.comment: Returns a list with all the windows in the windowStack. Used for testing.

params.name: includeMain
params.comment: if true, include the main root window.

return.comment: a list with all the windows in the windowStack. Used for testing.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the root window.
@return the root window.
methods.name: getMainWindow
methods.comment: Returns the root window.

return.comment: the root window.

methods.name: registerComponentLoadedListener
methods.comment:
Registers a callback to be notified when the given component has been parented to
 a docking window manager.

params.name: component
params.comment: the component that will be parented in a docking window system.

params.name: listener
params.comment: the listener to be notified the component was parented.

name: DockingWindowManager
comment:
Manages the "Docking" arrangement of a set of components and actions. The components can be "docked" 
 together or exist in their own window.  Actions can be associated with components so they
 "move" with the component as it moved from one location to another.
 
 Components are added via ComponentProviders.  A ComponentProvider is an interface for getting
 a component and its related information.  The docking window manager will get the component
 from the provider as needed.  It is up to the provider if it wants to reuse the component or
 recreate a new one when the component is requested.  When the user "hides" (by using 
 the x button on the component area) a component, the docking window manager removes all
 knowledge of the component and will request it again from the provider if the component
 becomes "unhidden".  The provider is also notified whenever a component is hidden.   Some
 providers will use the notification to remove the provider from the docking window manager so
 that the can not "unhide" the component using the built-in window menu.
